p: Model performance was measured using the area under the receiver operating characteristic curve (AUC). An AUC value closer to 1 represents near perfect performance of the model (Phillips et al., 2006). The output of Maxent comprised continuous values between 0 and 1 that were considered as probabilities of species’ occurrence. We then convert these values to presence and absence predictions, based on the threshold values that maximized training sensitivity plus specificity (Liu, Berry, Dawson, & Pearson, 2005; Songer et al., 2012). The cells with probability values above the threshold value were selected as suitable habitat for the giant panda. We then removed patches <4 km 2 and >0.5 km distance from the nearest patch based on the minimum home range size and the average daily dispersal ability of specie (Pan et al., 2001). A Mann–Whitney U test was used to examine the difference in mean elevation of suitable habitat between current and the 2050s. Statistical analyses were conducted using the SPSS 19.0 software (IBM Inc., USA).
